lines.text: This is the Arduino GRANDE. It acts like an oversized, fully functional Arduino, but it is actually a shield of sorts.
lines.text_raw: This is the Arduino GRANDE. It acts like an oversized, fully functional Arduino, but it is actually a shield of sorts.

lines.text: Wiring an actual Arduino board to the GRAND allows you to demonstrate Arduino programing and use on a much larger scale.
lines.text_raw: Wiring an actual Arduino board to the GRAND allows you to demonstrate Arduino programing and use on a much larger scale.

lines.text: Vector cut and raster etch the board file onto 5mm acrylic using a laser cutter.
lines.text_raw: Vector cut and raster etch the board file onto 5mm acrylic using a laser cutter.

lines.text: The files were created with Rhino, but can be printed with any laser cutter software that accepts common file formats.
lines.text_raw: The files were created with Rhino, but can be printed with any laser cutter software that accepts common file formats.

lines.text: Test speed and power settings to get a good, clean cut and neat etching.
lines.text_raw: Test speed and power settings to get a good, clean cut and neat etching.

lines.text: Cut the headers, USB, and power jack parts out of 6mm acrylic.
lines.text_raw: Cut the headers, USB, and power jack parts out of 6mm acrylic.

lines.text: Fill in the etching with white acrylic craft paint.
lines.text_raw: Fill in the etching with white acrylic craft paint.

lines.text: You can wipe off any excess from the smooth board surface, or do extra clean up with rubbing alcohol.
lines.text_raw: You can wipe off any excess from the smooth board surface, or do extra clean up with rubbing alcohol.

guide.summary: How to build a nearly 6x larger than real life, functioning Arduino.
guide.title: Arduino GRANDE
